item.title: Opinion: Monopoly money is going digital
item.description: There's an app for that! NPR's Scott Simon reflects on the news that the classic board game Monopoly will soon come with a banking app — no more paper money, math, or banking duties required.

item.title: Why there's always room for dessert, according to brain science
item.description: It doesn't matter how full you are, you can always fit in a bite or two or three of pie and ice cream. Scientists say it has to due with special neurons in our brain that just can't get enough sugar.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: HUD choked funding to enforce fair-housing laws. Legal aid groups may not survive
item.description: Most housing discrimination claims are handled by local nonprofits around the country. They say the Trump administration has hobbled them, and are challenging the cuts as unlawful.

item.title: Threat of tornadoes moves south after storm unleashes winds and fans wildfires
item.description: The threat of tornadoes moved east into the Mississippi Valley and Deep South on Saturday, a day after a massive storm system unleashed winds that damaged buildings in several central states.
